suggestedNewContent.title: Variables That Never Change: final
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain that 'final' creates a single-assignment variable. Show syntax: final name = 'Sarah'; or final String name = 'Sarah'; Demonstrate that reassignment causes error. Explain this is preferred in most cases per Effective Dart. Use analogy: 'A box you can put something in once, then it is sealed.'

suggestedNewContent.title: Compile-Time Constants: const
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain difference between runtime and compile-time. Show syntax: const pi = 3.14159; Explain const objects are deeply immutable and canonicalized. Show Flutter example: const EdgeInsets.all(8). Explain when const is required vs optional.

suggestedNewContent.title: var vs final vs const: Quick Decision Guide
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Provide simple decision tree: 1) Will value change? Yes -> var, No -> continue. 2) Is value known at compile time? Yes -> const, No -> final. Include table comparing the three. Mention Effective Dart preference for final over var when possible.

suggestedNewContent.title: Common Variable Mistakes to Avoid
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Consolidate common mistakes into dedicated warning section. Include: 1) Using var when final is better 2) Confusing String and String? 3) Forgetting to initialize non-nullable variables 4) Using dynamic instead of proper types 5) Reassigning final/const variables

suggestedNewContent.title: Variables in a Real Flutter App
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Show practical Flutter example with const for colors/dimensions, final for controller references, var for mutable state. Connect variable concepts to actual Flutter development patterns.

summary: The lesson provides a solid foundation for variable basics with a good analogy and covers null safety well. However, it critically omits 'final' and 'const' keywords which are fundamental to modern Dart development and emphasized in Effective Dart guidelines. The lesson should be updated to include these keywords, add a decision guide for choosing between var/final/const, and include more Flutter-specific examples. The challenge solution also needs updating to avoid hardcoded year values.
